ts.support

Class TSValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • ts.support.TSValue
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TSPrimitive, TSReference

    public abstract class TSValue
extends java.lang.Object
    The super class for all Tscript values.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TSValue() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TSPrimitive add(TSValue right)
      Perform an addition.
      TSValue getValue()
      Get the value.
      boolean isUndefined()
      Is this value Undefined? Override only in TSUndefined and TSReference.
      TSNumber multiply(TSValue right)
      Perform a multiply.

      Assign to the value.
      TSValue simpleAssignment(TSValue right)
      Perform an assignment.

      Convert to Primitive.

      Convert to String.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TSValue

        public TSValue()

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public TSValue getValue()
        Get the value. This method is only overridden in TSReference. Otherwise just return "this".

      • putValue

        public void putValue(TSValue value)
        Assign to the value. This method is only overridden in TSReference. Otherwise just report an error.

      • toPrimitive

        TSPrimitive toPrimitive()
        Convert to Primitive. Override only in TSObject and TSReference. Otherwise just return "this". Note: type hint is not implemented.

      • toNumber

        public abstract TSNumber toNumber()

      • toStr

        public TSString toStr()
        Convert to String. Override for all primitive types and TSReference. It can't be called toString because of Object.toString.

      • multiply

        public final TSNumber multiply(TSValue right)
        Perform a multiply. "this" is the left operand and the right operand is given by the parameter. Both operands are converted to Number before the multiply.

      • add

        public final TSPrimitive add(TSValue right)
        Perform an addition. "this" is the left operand and the right operand is given by the parameter. Both operands are converted to Number before the addition.

      • simpleAssignment

        public final TSValue simpleAssignment(TSValue right)
        Perform an assignment. "this" is the left operand and the right operand is given by the parameter.

      • isUndefined

        public boolean isUndefined()
        Is this value Undefined? Override only in TSUndefined and TSReference.
